channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Exhausted? Irritable? It could be undiagnosed iron deficiency
item.description: Around a third of women of reproductive age could have low iron. But doctors don’t routinely screen for the condition, though it can lead to anemia. Symptoms include exhaustion, headaches and more.
item.content:encoded:
Around a third of women of reproductive age could have low iron. But doctors don’t routinely screen for the condition, though it can lead to anemia. Symptoms include exhaustion, headaches and more.

(Image credit: ktsdesign/Science Photo Library)
item.dc:creator: Lourdes Medrano

item.title: How do you help young Afghan refugees heal? A new program in Maine offers a way
item.description: Research shows that a toxic mix of past traumas and the stresses of resettlement puts refugee kids at significantly higher risk of long term mental health challenges. A new effort aims to mitigate those risks by supporting parents and children in refugee families.
item.content:encoded:
Research shows that a toxic mix of past traumas and the stresses of resettlement puts refugee kids at significantly higher risk of long term mental health challenges. A new effort aims to mitigate those risks by supporting parents and children in refugee families.

(Image credit: Raquel C. Zaldívar)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: Eating less beef is a climate solution. Here's why that's hard for some American men
item.description: Climate researchers have long grappled with how to get Americans to eat less beef, a food with a huge global warming impact. Now some are thinking about it through the lens of gender.
item.content:encoded:
Climate researchers have long grappled with how to get Americans to eat less beef, a food with a huge global warming impact. Now some are thinking about it through the lens of gender.

(Image credit: Jackie Lay/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: State bans on commercial food waste have been largely ineffective, study finds
item.description: Much of the food supply in the U.S. goes uneaten, which contributes to climate change. Some states have tried to cut food waste in landfills, but their efforts have fallen short, researchers found.
item.content:encoded:
Much of the food supply in the U.S. goes uneaten, which contributes to climate change. Some states have tried to cut food waste in landfills, but their efforts have fallen short, researchers found.

(Image credit: Paul Sancya)
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: If Harris wins, she would make history. But she isn’t talking about that
item.description: Hillary Clinton leaned into her identity when she ran for president. Vice President Kamala Harris is decidedly not.
item.content:encoded:
Hillary Clinton leaned into her identity when she ran for president. Vice President Kamala Harris is decidedly not.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Four astronauts on Polaris Dawn flight return to Earth after 1st commercial spacewalk
item.description: The five-day trip, funded by internet entrepreneur Jared Isaacman, broke several records including the first-ever commercial spacewalk using SpaceX’s Crew Dragon capsule on Polaris Dawn mission.
item.content:encoded:
The five-day trip, funded by internet entrepreneur Jared Isaacman, broke several records including the first-ever commercial spacewalk using SpaceX’s Crew Dragon capsule on Polaris Dawn mission.

(Image credit: Image courtesy of SpaceX via X.com)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Venezuela says it arrested 6 foreigners allegedly involved in a plot to kill Maduro
item.description: Three Americans, two Spaniards and a Czech citizen were arrested after Venezuelan officials accused them of coming to the South American country to assassinate President Nicolas Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
Three Americans, two Spaniards and a Czech citizen were arrested after Venezuelan officials accused them of coming to the South American country to assassinate President Nicolas Maduro.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How we grow food affects the climate. Here are solutions communities are taking to help
item.description: We've gathered examples from across the NPR Network of how we can change the food we grow to support climate goals.
item.content:encoded:
We've gathered examples from across the NPR Network of how we can change the food we grow to support climate goals.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: FDA approves some Apple AirPods to be used as hearing aids
item.description: An upcoming Apple software update will allow some AirPods to double as over-the-counter hearing aids. Only 1 in 6 American adults with hearing loss wears hearing aids.
item.content:encoded:
An upcoming Apple software update will allow some AirPods to double as over-the-counter hearing aids. Only 1 in 6 American adults with hearing loss wears hearing aids.

(Image credit: Juliana Yamada)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: In Portland, thousands gather to marvel at migrating birds’ nighttime routine
item.description: As Vaux’s Swifts migrate south, they roost together in a chimney, drawing crowds
item.content:encoded:
As Vaux’s Swifts migrate south, they roost together in a chimney, drawing crowds

(Image credit: Celeste Noche)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep
